item.title: automated decision-making systems
item.description: what is a process or decision that used to be made by humans and is now automated by sophisticated algorithms? apart from obvious real-world examples of automated decision-making systems (adms) of self-driving cars and trading, where 85% of all transactions in the foreign exchange markets is conducted by algorithms alone (demetis, 2021), bidding bots for freelance project posts represent another example of adms produced for a niche market, in which i was participating during my high-school days.

item.title: contact
item.description: feel free to get in touch with me anytime by calling me at +447863450217 writing me at ljelic.mam2022@london.edu coming by to regent’s park nw1 4sa london

item.title: ethical breakdowns
item.description: how i have seen one of unethical barriers interfere with ethical behaviour in the past? to illustrate one type of unethical barrier, named by the authors as “ill-conceived goals” (bazerman and tenbrunsel, 2011), the following paragraph describes a particular behavioural pattern present within customer support teams or individuals focused on quantity rather than quality, i.e., oriented to maximizing the number of positive feedbacks rather than to increasing customer satisfaction.

item.title: projects
item.description: take a look at the projects that i have done so far at london business school risk-return analysis of the nyse stocks excess rentals in tfl bike sharing automated decision-making systems ethical breakdowns for more exciting projects take a look at my github profile s
